soc.robot.sample3p

Class Sample3PBrain

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • soc.robot.SOCRobotBrain
        • soc.robot.sample3p.Sample3PBrain
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Sample3PBrain
extends SOCRobotBrain
    Sample of a trivially simple "third-party" subclass of SOCRobotBrain Instantiated by Sample3PClient.

    Trivial behavioral changes from standard SOCRobotBrain:

    • When sitting down, greet the game members: setOurPlayerData()
    • Uses third-party SampleDiscardStrategy: setStrategyFields()
    • Reject trades unless we're offered clay or sheep: considerOffer(SOCTradeOffer)
    Since:
    2.0.00
    Author:
    Jeremy D Monin

    • Method Detail

      • setOurPlayerData

        public void setOurPlayerData()
        After the standard actions of SOCRobotBrain.setOurPlayerData(), sends a "hello" chat message as a sample action using SOCDisplaylessPlayerClient.sendText(SOCGame, String). This bot also overrides setStrategyFields().

        If the for-bots extra game option SOCGameOptionSet.K__EXT_BOT was set at the server command line, prints its value to System.err. A third-party bot might want to use that option's value to configure its behavior or debug settings.

        I18N Note: Robots don't know what languages or locales the human players can read: It would be unfair for a bot to ever send text that the players must understand for gameplay. So this sample bot's "hello" is not localized.

        Overrides:
        setOurPlayerData in class SOCRobotBrain

      • setStrategyFields

        protected void setStrategyFields()
        Override to use our custom SampleDiscardStrategy. All other strategies are standard.
        Overrides:
        setStrategyFields in class SOCRobotBrain

      • considerOffer

        protected int considerOffer(SOCTradeOffer offer)
        Consider a trade offer; reject if we aren't offered clay or sheep.

        Consider a trade offer made by another player. If offered to our player, calls SOCRobotNegotiator.considerOffer2(SOCTradeOffer, int).

        Overrides:
        considerOffer in class SOCRobotBrain
        Parameters:
        offer - the offer to consider
        Returns:
        a code from SOCRobotNegotiator that represents how we want to respond: IGNORE_OFFER, ACCEPT_OFFER, REJECT_OFFER, or COUNTER_OFFER. Note: any negative value returned means we do nothing (IGNORE_OFFER).
        See Also:
        SOCRobotBrain.makeCounterOffer(SOCTradeOffer)
